concept.title: Audience Library
concept.shortdesc: The Marketing Cloud Audience Library (real-time audiences) is the interface that lets you create audiences, combine existing audiences to create composite audiences, and view all shared audiences.

section.title: About Audiences
section.p:
Audiences are collections of visitors (a list of visitor IDs). Adobe's audience services manages the translation of visitor data into audience segmentation. As such, creating and managing audiences is similar to creating and using segments, with the added ability to share the audience segment to the
Marketing Cloud.
Audiences can be created or derived from various sources, such as:

ul.li: New ones created in the Marketing Cloud
From Analytics segments published to the Marketing Cloud

section.p: All Master Marketing Profile audiences, regardless of where they are sourced, are accessible for real-time targeting use cases. The system evaluates of audiences in two ways:

ul.li: Audiences sourced from Analytics are evaluated every 12 hours.
Audiences sourced in Audience Library are evaluated real-time.

section.p: Some examples of how to use audiences in Marketing Cloud solutions:

entry.p: Marketing Cloud Audience Library
Create, manage, and share audiences natively using the Audience Library interface. You can:

ul.li: Use real-time audiences using raw analytics attributes
Combine audiences to create composite ones, joining real-time and historical data
See graphical views of estimated audiences size

entry.p: Analytics
In reporting and ad hoc analysis segmentation, you can build a segment, combine it with a report suite, and then publish the segment to the Marketing Cloud.
Publishing the segment displays it on the Audience Library page. The audience is also available as a targeted audience for a campaign experience delivered by Adobe Target, and in audience management.

Once an audience is shared from Analytics, and selected for use in an active campaign, all of the visitor profiles who met the segment definition criteria for the past 90 days are sent to the Marketing Cloud Audience Services platform.
Mobile Services
Analyze mobile traffic using the sunburst visualization in the Device Types report.
Target
Leverage the master marketing profile that unifies visitor IDs and data into a single, actionable profile for use across solutions.

The Publish to the Marketing Cloud checkbox during the segment creation process in Adobe Analytics allows the segment to be available within the Adobe Target's custom audience library. A segment created in Analytics or audience management can be used to for activities in Target.
For example, you can create campaign activities based on Analytics conversion metrics and audience segments created in Analytics.
Media Optimizer

Audience management: Shared audiences are available in
audience management segmentation in Media Optimizer. All Marketing Cloud audiences are available natively in audience management, which provides:

ul.li: Built-in automation regarding how they are shared and consumed in solution workflows

entry.p: Advertising management: Use the audience as targets.

section.title: Audiences Library - Descriptions
section.p: The Marketing Cloud provides and library for creating and managing audiences, with native, real-time audience identification.

entry.p: Lets you create an audience.
A column heading that identifies and describes the audience.
The person who created the audience segment.
Source
Identifies where the audience was created.
Analytics: A segment created in reports & analytics or ad hoc analysis, then published to the Marketing Cloud.
Marketing Cloud: A new audience created in the Audience Library.
Audience Manager: Audiences created audience management (Media Optimizer) automatically display in the Audience Library.
Current Size
The current audience size.
Active
The active status of the segment.

section.title: Limitations in Using Audience Library
section.p: If you do not use the audience management capability in Media Optimizer, the following limits exist:

entry.p: Audiences created wholly or partially* in Analytics segmentation.

Up to 20 of these can be active in a campaign at any time. There is no limit to the number of audiences that can be flagged in Analytics as available to the audience service in the Marketing Cloud. However, only 20 can be active at once.
(*Partially indicates an audience that is a combination of data derived from Analytics, plus the real-time values collected in the Audience Library.)
Audiences built natively in the Marketing Cloud Audience Library.
The limit is 50 at any time.
Traits built natively in Marketing Cloud Audience Library.
The limit is 100 at any time.

section.p: There is no limit to the number of managed profiles or to the number of users that can be assigned to a single audience.

entry.p: Additional limits associated with shared profiles

ul.li: Non-Marketing Cloud destinations for audiences are not allowed.
Audience management data integration capabilities are not available. 1st, 2nd, or 3rd-party data cannot be brought in through audience management.
Reporting functionality is also limited compared to audience management.
